text: The blotch-necked moray eel (Gymnothorax margaritophorus) is a moray eel found in coral reefs in the Pacific and Indian Oceans.Gymnothorax margaritophorus at www.fishbase.org. It was first named by Pieter Bleeker in 1864, and is also commonly known as the blackpearl moray, pearly moray, pearly reef-eel, or the trunk-eyed moray.Common names for Gymnothorax margaritophorus at www.fishbase.org. ==References== margaritophorus Category:Fish described in 1864
title: Blotch-necked moray eel
